result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaylon James Brown

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 1 from preliminary hearing - Certified copy of bail bond sheet from 22CF84

8:56 AM Defendant Jaylon James Brown in court.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews record, notes that case has been pending since June 2022.  Mr Brown has Attorney Gondik representing him in another matter.  At a previous hearing stated he was going to retain Attorney Gondik but has not.
State prepared to proceed.
Defendant is not prepared to proceed; does not have counsel.  Indicates started a new job.
Defendant requests to adjourn a month.
Court is not inclined to adjourn once again.
State requests to proceed today.

State calls Austin Lauridsen, sworn and testifies.
Police officer, city of Superior WI Douglas County.
On duty 6/21/22, traffic stop.
Witness identifies defendant
Defendant does not know what to say.
Record reflects identification of defendant.
Parking lot of Super One on Oakes Avenue, Superior WI Douglas County

Defendant has no questions for the witness.

States exhibit 1-certified copy of bail sheet 22CF84-MOR
State shows defendant what has been marked as exhibit 1.  Defendant indicates to the court that he does not know what it is, does not know what exhibit means and believes he has the right to an attorney.
Court reviews exhibit 1.
Defendant has no response
State requests that the court take judicial notice of case 22cf84..
Court takes notice.

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
State requests to se this 9/16/22.
Defendant would like more time instead of setting this case for 9/16/22.
Court sets
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:42 AM Defendant Jaylon James Brown in court.  Attorney Jacob Gondik Jr in court for Jaylon James Brown.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates motion to withdraw filed. Defendant has another matter for which Mr. Gondik has not yet been appointed. Asking for reset of prelim in that matter. Asks for status in this matter. 
in 22CF232 defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
8:25 AM Defendant Jaylon James Brown in court.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant if he has retained Atty Gondik on this case; defendant indicates that he has not. 
Defendant is requesting to reset hearing and waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  
Court accepts waiver as knowing and voluntary
Has not retained Attorney Gondik for this case.
Court notes that defendant brought his infant child to court today, re sets preliminary hearing and does not set an attorney STC.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jaylon James Brown
Current: 1107 Clough Ave, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 06-23-2022)
Prior: 1123 Hughitt Av, Superior, WI 54880

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jaylon James Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob S Gondik in court for Jaylon James Brown. Defendant's address is verified. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $5,000 cash. Do not possess any firearms. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State indicates that defendant is currently out on bail in a pending felony case. Attorney Gondik notes that he is making a special appearance. Defendant is a local resident, family lives in the area, and does not have any amount he can post. Asks for high signature bond and low cash bond. Court notes nature of the charges and failure to follow court orders. Court orders $2,500 cash bail. Do not possess any firearms.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
